title.narrative: INSTITUTIONAL MECHANISMS FOR QUALITY EDU

description.narrative: Improved institutional mechanisms for planning, management, coordination and monitoring for quality primary education, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Learning outcomes, completion in primary education and transition to post-primary education for all improved

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved institutional mechanisms for planning, management, coordination and monitoring for quality primary education

description.narrative: Predictability of financing and improved allocation or resources for the implementation of the NESP II was secured through the operationalization of a Joint Education Sector Fund. Policy makers and programmers will have improved access to disaggregated education data and information on the national, district and zonal levels from 2018. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/12/2018

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - National EMIS provides quality and timely data - score (1-4), see guidance
System for monitoring learning outcomes developed
Education sector policy planned, developed and operationalised
Education systems are implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote learning outcomes including early learning
